results.title: High heels
results.creator_credit: Victorian Women's Film Unit and Sue Brooks
results.brief_description: In the 1980’s high heels are back in fashion and women are back in high heels. Why is it feminine to walk in high heels? What does it do to your spine? Does a woman who is helpless need help? What is the appeal of restrictive fashion? And in what way do high heels restrict us? Why do women wear high heels? Written by Alison Tilson.

results.title: High Ground
results.brief_description: An historical overview of building development in the City of Melbourne culminating in the building of 101 Collins Street. Some fascinating archival footage is used to illustrate how the top end of Collins Street and the city in general developed as “the high ground”.
results.description: An historical overview of building development in the City of Melbourne culminating in the building of 101 Collins Street. Some fascinating archival footage is used to illustrate how the top end of Collins Street and the city in general developed as “the high ground”.

results.title: High grass circus
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Bill Brind, Colin Low, Torben Schioler and Tony Ianzelo
results.brief_description: A ticket to entertainment at the Royal Brothers’ Circus - the only Canadian tent circus in Canada. Filmed during a hectic summer season, with the Big Top up, in transit, or being erected, it vividly captures the 24-hour-a-day brand of circus magic and observes both the men and mechanics behind it. Like the circus itself, it hovers between comedy, sentimentality and the grotesque. An abridged version entitled ‘Little Big Top’ is also available. (Awards: Yorkton, Los Angeles)

results.title: High frequency heating
results.creator_credit: Merton Park, Frank A. Hoare and John Durst
results.brief_description: Explains heating by induction and dielectric heating. The film illustrates how this heating effect is used in industry and medicine.

results.title: High fidelity
results.creator_credit: Working Title Films, Tim Bevan, Rudd Simmons and Stephen Frears
results.brief_description: This cult retro-pop-classic based on the book by Nick Hornby takes the audience back to the pop culture of the 80’s. Enter the jaded Rob (John Cusack), owner of Championship Vinyl, a man in his late 30’s whose passion for music and Peter Pan approach to life has caught up with him. When present girlfriend, Laura (Iben Kjejle), leaves him, he names his top 5 most memorable break-ups. The audience is taken on a loop of youth culture as well as being offered a glimpse into the male view of matters of the heart. The film uses Rob’s side-kicks (the “musical moron twins”), Dick and Barry (played by Todd Louiso Jack Black respectively), to help play homage to the music scene, never faltering, the two pastiche’ musical obsession to new heights, peppering the film with their top 5’s and hilarious musical anecdotes and showdowns. With a guest appearance by Bruce Springsteen, the cast is well courted with actors including Tim Robbins, Joan Cusack, Lisa Bonet, Lili Taylor and Catherine Zeta-Jones. Video also includes a 6 minute interview with John Cusack about the making of the film.

results.title: High endeavour
results.creator_credit: British Information Services and Martin Films
results.brief_description: The design, construction and testing of the Avro Vulcan, the world’s first four-jet delta-wing bomber, now playing an important role in Britain’s defence system. An historical introduction includes sequences on the Vulcan’s famous predecessor, the Lancaster, and shows some of its wartime exploits.

results.title: High country children of New Zealand
results.creator_credit: Gibson Film Productions, Dave Gibson and Yvonne MacKay
results.brief_description: Two children - Malcolm and Nerelli Prouting - live with their family on a sheep station in the isolated high country of south New Zealand. This film shows their daily lives from the excitement of mustering high up in the hills to mundane correspondence school work. Filmed on location at Mount Arrowsmith Station, New Zealand.

results.title: High art [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: October Films, Dolly Hall, Jeff Levy-Hinte, Susan A Stover and Lisa Cholodenko
results.brief_description: Syd (Radha Mitchell) is a young women with a perfectly nice boyfriend and a perfectly good job working for an up-market photography magazine in New York City. But she is bored and keen for adventure, hoping to achieve more status and celebrity through work. A chance encounter with a legendary underground photographer, Lucy Berliner (Ally Sheedy), enables Syd to move into the exotic fringes of the art world, as well as allowing her to explore her own sexuality and her own desires. But “High Art” is not a New Age film: we watch Syd’s pursuit of Lucy and of fame, and we are asked to confront deeply disturbing questions about the amorality of contemporary relationships and culture. Art may be what all the characters in this film claim to care about, but their real pursuits are status and fame. Only Lucy Berliner, passionate about her photography, seems capable of committing herself to a notion of art that is not simply reducible to commerce. But Lucy’s passion comes at a cost: life on the fringe, the dangers of drugs, and the continual question of where the rent money is going to come from. The final moments of this film, in which Syd faces what is really of value in the world of “high art”, are shattering. Music by Shudder to Think. Sheedy and Mitchell are outstanding. Winner of the Jury Prize at the Sundance Film Festival.
